intro: Ambrina retusa, commonly known as the smooth ambrina, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its seeds are dispersed by animals that eat its fleshy, red berries.
